text:
I am on Solaris 9/sparc using gcc

After using ./configure --prefix=/usr/local/apache2
I execute make and receive the following error.

creator: web@txnb.uscourts.gov

text:
I have no idea what might be going on, but here are a few things to check:

Is there anything in the directory "/home/rbartlet/httpd-2.0.47/srclib/pcre/.libs"?

Did it build anything in srclib/pcre?  Are there some .o and .lo files?

Did you run buildconf prior to configure, or are you using the configure script
as provided?
creator: trawick@apache.org
web@txnb.uscourts.gov
text:
In /home/rbartlet/httpd-2.0.47/srclib/pcre/.libs is this file
libpcre.la -> ../libpcre.la


Here is the ls for srclib/pcre
.               .deps           .libs           pcre-config.in  pcretest.c
..              dftables        LICENCE         pcre.def        perltest
AUTHORS         dftables.c      ltconfig        pcredemo.c      perltest8
ChangeLog       dftables.dsp    ltmain.sh       pcre.dsp        pgrep.c
chartables.c    dftables.lo     Makefile        pcregrep.c      README
config.guess    dftables.o      Makefile.in     pcre.h          RunTest
config.h        dll.mk          maketables.c    pcre.hw         RunTest.in
config.hw       doc             maketables.lo   pcre.in         study.c
config.in       get.c           maketables.o    pcre.lo         study.lo
config.log      get.lo          mkinstalldirs   pcre.o          study.o
config.status   get.o           NEWS            pcreposix.c     testdata
config.sub      INSTALL         NON-UNIX-USE    pcreposix.dsp
configure       install-sh      NWGNUmakefile   pcreposix.h
configure.in    internal.h      pcre.c          pcreposix.lo
COPYING         libpcre.la      pcre-config     pcreposix.o


I am using the configure script provided?  Should I do something differently?


Also, is it possible that I don't have one of the necessary libraries?  If so, 
is there a list of all the necessary libraries?

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
Is this still reproducible with 2.0.53?  Could have been an issue with older
versions of libtool used in old tarballs.
